description: World's leading software development platform with Git version control
long_description: GitHub is a development platform inspired by the way you work. From open source to business, you can host and review code, manage projects, and build software alongside 50 million developers.
features: Git repositories, Issue tracking, Pull requests, Actions CI/CD, Code review
pros_cons: PROS: Free for public repos, excellent collaboration tools, huge ecosystem CONS: Can be complex for beginners, private repos require paid plans
use_cases: Perfect for software development teams, open source projects, and code collaboration

description: Collaborative interface design tool for teams
long_description: Figma is a vector graphics editor and prototyping tool which is primarily web-based, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications.
features: Vector design, Prototyping, Real-time collaboration, Component libraries, Developer handoff
pros_cons: PROS: Real-time collaboration, cross-platform, great prototyping CONS: Requires internet connection, can be slow with large files
use_cases: UI/UX design, prototyping, design systems, team collaboration

description: All-in-one workspace for notes, tasks, wikis, and databases
long_description: Notion is a collaboration platform with modified Markdown support that integrates kanban boards, tasks, wikis and databases.
features: Note-taking, Task management, Databases, Templates, Team collaboration
pros_cons: PROS: Highly customizable, great for documentation, powerful database features CONS: Can be overwhelming, steep learning curve
use_cases: Project management, documentation, note-taking, team wikis

long_description: Slack is a cloud-based team collaboration tool that brings all your communication together. Organize conversations into channels, share files, and integrate with your favorite tools.
features: Channels, Direct messaging, File sharing, App integrations, Video calls
pros_cons: PROS: Great integrations, organized conversations, searchable history CONS: Can be noisy, expensive for large teams
use_cases: Team communication, project coordination, remote work collaboration

description: Frontend deployment platform with zero configuration
long_description: Vercel is a cloud platform for static sites and Serverless Functions that fits perfectly with your workflow. It enables developers to host websites and web services that deploy instantly, scale automatically, and require no supervision.
features: Instant deployments, Automatic SSL, Edge Network, Preview deployments, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: Zero configuration, excellent performance, great DX CONS: Can get expensive at scale, vendor lock-in
use_cases: Static sites, Next.js apps, serverless functions, preview environments

description: Complete payments platform for the internet
long_description: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of every size use Stripe's software to accept payments and manage their businesses online.
features: Payment processing, Subscriptions, Invoicing, Fraud prevention, Global payments
pros_cons: PROS: Easy integration, excellent documentation, powerful API CONS: Transaction fees add up, complex pricing for edge cases
use_cases: SaaS billing, e-commerce payments, subscription management, marketplace transactions

description: AI research and deployment company with powerful APIs
long_description: OpenAI provides access to powerful AI models including GPT-4, DALL-E, and Whisper through simple APIs. Build AI-powered applications with state-of-the-art language models.
features: GPT models, Image generation, Speech-to-text, Embeddings, Fine-tuning
pros_cons: PROS: State-of-the-art models, easy API, great docs CONS: Can be expensive, rate limits, API changes
use_cases: Chatbots, content generation, code assistance, text analysis, image generation

description: Open source Firebase alternative with PostgreSQL
long_description: Supabase is an open source Firebase alternative. It provides a Postgres database, authentication, instant APIs, edge functions, realtime subscriptions, and storage.
features: PostgreSQL database, Authentication, Realtime subscriptions, Storage, Edge functions
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, SQL database, generous free tier CONS: Newer platform, smaller community than Firebase
use_cases: Web applications, mobile backends, realtime apps, user authentication

description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development
long_description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework packed with classes that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup.
features: Utility classes, Responsive design, Dark mode, Custom themes, JIT compiler
pros_cons: PROS: Fast development, consistent design, great documentation CONS: HTML can get verbose, learning curve for utility-first approach
use_cases: Web application styling, rapid prototyping, design systems, responsive layouts

long_description: Resend is the email platform for developers. Send transactional and marketing emails with a simple API and beautiful React email templates.
features: Email API, React email templates, Webhooks, Analytics, Domain authentication
pros_cons: PROS: Developer-friendly, React templates, generous free tier CONS: Newer service, limited integrations compared to SendGrid
use_cases: Transactional emails, password resets, notifications, newsletters

description: Popular code editor from Microsoft with extensions
long_description: Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js and has a rich ecosystem of extensions for other languages and runtimes.
features: IntelliSense, Debugging, Git integration, Extensions marketplace, Terminal
pros_cons: PROS: Free, huge extension library, regular updates, great performance CONS: Can be resource-heavy with many extensions
use_cases: Software development, code editing, debugging, version control

description: API platform for building and testing APIs
long_description: Postman is an API platform for developers to design, build, test and iterate their APIs. It simplifies each step of the API lifecycle and streamlines collaboration.
features: API testing, Collections, Mock servers, Documentation, Automated testing
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive API testing, great collaboration features, detailed docs CONS: Learning curve for advanced features, pricing can add up
use_cases: API development, testing REST/GraphQL APIs, API documentation, team collaboration

description: Containerization platform for consistent development environments
long_description: Docker is a platform designed to help developers build, share, and run modern applications. It handles tedious setup and enables instant delivery of containerized apps.
features: Containerization, Docker Compose, Image registry, Orchestration, Multi-platform builds
pros_cons: PROS: Consistent environments, easy deployment, great for microservices CONS: Learning curve, resource overhead, complex networking
use_cases: Development environments, microservices, CI/CD, application deployment

description: Modern issue tracking for software teams
long_description: Linear is a streamlined issue tracking tool built for modern software teams. It's designed to be fast, opinionated, and delightful to use.
features: Issue tracking, Sprint planning, Roadmaps, Git integration, Keyboard shortcuts
pros_cons: PROS: Incredibly fast, great UX, keyboard-first, Git integrations CONS: Opinionated workflow, limited customization vs Jira
use_cases: Sprint planning, bug tracking, feature development, product roadmaps

description: Visual project management with boards and cards
long_description: Trello's boards, lists, and cards enable you to organize and prioritize your projects in a fun, flexible, and rewarding way. Perfect for teams of any size.
features: Kanban boards, Cards, Labels, Power-Ups, Automation, Templates
pros_cons: PROS: Simple and intuitive, free tier is generous, good mobile apps CONS: Can get messy at scale, limited reporting
use_cases: Task management, project planning, content calendars, personal organization

description: Work management platform for team coordination
long_description: Asana is a web and mobile work management platform designed to help teams organize, track, and manage their work. From tasks to projects to conversations.
features: Task management, Timeline view, Portfolios, Goals, Automation, Reporting
pros_cons: PROS: Powerful features, multiple views, great for complex projects CONS: Can be overwhelming, expensive for large teams
use_cases: Project planning, task tracking, team workflows, cross-functional collaboration

long_description: monday.com Work OS is an open platform that democratizes the power of software so organizations can easily build work management tools and software applications to fit their every need.
features: Customizable workflows, Automation, Time tracking, Forms, Multiple views, Integrations
pros_cons: PROS: Highly customizable, visual interface, great automation CONS: Can be expensive, steep learning curve
use_cases: Team collaboration, workflow management, CRM, project tracking

long_description: Airtable is a low-code platform for building collaborative apps. Customize your workflow, collaborate, and achieve ambitious outcomes. Perfect for teams looking for more power than a spreadsheet.
features: Flexible databases, Views, Forms, Automations, Extensions, API
pros_cons: PROS: Flexible and powerful, great UI, many integrations CONS: Can get expensive, performance issues with large datasets
use_cases: Content planning, CRM, project management, inventory tracking, databases

description: Visual web design platform without coding
long_description: Webflow is a visual web development platform that allows designers to build responsive websites without writing code. Export clean code or host with Webflow.
features: Visual design, CMS, Ecommerce, Hosting, Animations, Responsive design
pros_cons: PROS: Professional results without code, great hosting, SEO-friendly CONS: Learning curve, can get expensive
use_cases: Marketing websites, portfolios, landing pages, blogs, e-commerce

long_description: Framer is a web builder for creative pros. Design and publish modern websites with advanced interactions and animations, without writing code.
features: Interactive prototypes, Animations, Components, CMS, Publishing, Responsive design
pros_cons: PROS: Great for interactive prototypes, easy animations, can export code CONS: Learning curve, limited compared to Figma for design
use_cases: Interactive prototypes, website design, landing pages, design handoff

description: UX/UI design and collaboration tool from Adobe
long_description: Adobe XD is a vector-based user experience design tool for web apps and mobile apps. Design, prototype, and share user experiences for websites, mobile apps, voice interfaces, and more.
features: Design tools, Prototyping, Collaboration, Plugins, Auto-animate, Voice prototyping
pros_cons: PROS: Free tier available, Adobe integration, good prototyping CONS: Less popular than Figma, limited community resources
use_cases: UI/UX design, prototyping, wireframing, design systems

long_description: Sketch is a design toolkit built to help you create your best work — from early ideas through to final artwork. Used by millions of designers worldwide.
features: Vector editing, Symbols, Prototyping, Collaboration, Plugins, Cloud documents
pros_cons: PROS: Mac-native performance, large plugin ecosystem, industry standard CONS: Mac-only, requires subscription, losing market share to Figma
use_cases: UI design, icon design, design systems, wireframing

long_description: Canva is a graphic design platform that allows users to create social media graphics, presentations, posters, and other visual content. It's available on web and mobile.
features: Templates, Drag-and-drop editor, Stock photos, Brand kit, Collaboration, Social media scheduling
pros_cons: PROS: Very easy to use, huge template library, affordable CONS: Limited customization, can look generic, not for UI design
use_cases: Social media graphics, presentations, marketing materials, simple designs

long_description: Miro is the online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from brainstorming to planning and executing projects.
features: Infinite canvas, Templates, Sticky notes, Diagramming, Video chat, Integrations
pros_cons: PROS: Great for remote collaboration, many templates, easy to use CONS: Can get expensive for teams, performance with large boards
use_cases: Brainstorming, user journey mapping, workshops, agile ceremonies, wireframing

description: Voice, video and text chat for communities
long_description: Discord is the easiest way to talk over voice, video, and text. Talk, chat, hang out, and stay close with your friends and communities.
features: Voice channels, Text channels, Screen sharing, Server roles, Bots, Communities
pros_cons: PROS: Free for most features, great voice quality, strong community features CONS: Can be noisy, not ideal for formal business
use_cases: Community building, customer support, team communication, developer communities

long_description: Zoom is a video-first unified communications platform for meetings, training, webinars, and collaborative spaces. Connect and collaborate from anywhere.
features: Video meetings, Webinars, Screen sharing, Recording, Breakout rooms, Virtual backgrounds
pros_cons: PROS: Reliable, easy to use, good free tier, recording features CONS: Security concerns, 40-min limit on free tier
use_cases: Team meetings, client calls, webinars, remote interviews, virtual events

long_description: Loom is a video messaging tool that helps you get your message across through instantly shareable videos. Record yourself, your screen, or both.
features: Screen recording, Webcam recording, Video editing, Comments, Transcriptions, Sharing
pros_cons: PROS: Quick and easy, great for async communication, good for demos CONS: Free tier limits video length, limited editing features
use_cases: Product demos, bug reports, tutorials, async updates, customer support

long_description: Intercom is a Conversational Relationship Platform (CRP) that helps businesses build better customer relationships through personalized, messenger-based experiences.
features: Live chat, Chatbots, Help center, Product tours, Email campaigns, Customer data
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive platform, great UX, powerful automation CONS: Expensive, can be complex to set up
use_cases: Customer support, sales conversations, user onboarding, in-app messaging

description: Customer messaging and live chat platform
long_description: Crisp is a customer service software that brings all your customer conversations into one place. Chat, email, messenger - all unified in a beautiful interface.
features: Live chat, Chatbots, Knowledge base, Shared inbox, CRM, Mobile apps
pros_cons: PROS: Generous free tier, affordable pricing, clean UI CONS: Fewer features than Intercom, smaller ecosystem
use_cases: Customer support, live chat, team inbox, knowledge base, chatbots

long_description: Google Analytics gives you the free tools you need to analyze data for your business in one place. Understand your customers and grow your business.
features: Traffic tracking, User behavior, Conversion tracking, Audience insights, Custom reports, Real-time data
pros_cons: PROS: Free, comprehensive data, industry standard, Google integration CONS: Complex for beginners, privacy concerns, GA4 learning curve
use_cases: Website analytics, traffic analysis, conversion tracking, user behavior

long_description: Plausible is a lightweight and open-source website analytics tool. No cookies and fully compliant with GDPR, CCPA and PECR. Made and hosted in the EU.
features: Privacy-focused, Lightweight script, Simple dashboard, Event tracking, Custom domains, Email reports
pros_cons: PROS: Privacy-focused, GDPR compliant, simple UI, lightweight CONS: Paid only, fewer features than GA, limited historical data on lower tiers
use_cases: Website analytics, traffic tracking, privacy-compliant analytics

description: Product analytics for mobile and web
long_description: Mixpanel is a product analytics platform that helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data.
features: Event tracking, User analytics, Funnels, Retention analysis, A/B testing, Cohorts
pros_cons: PROS: Powerful product analytics, good free tier, user-centric tracking CONS: Can get expensive quickly, complex for simple needs
use_cases: Product analytics, user behavior tracking, funnel analysis, retention

long_description: Amplitude is a product analytics platform that helps teams build better products by understanding user behavior with behavioral analytics.
features: Event tracking, User segmentation, Behavioral cohorts, Experiment tracking, Retention analysis, Dashboards
pros_cons: PROS: Powerful analytics, great for product teams, generous free tier CONS: Complex setup, steep learning curve
use_cases: Product analytics, user journey analysis, feature adoption, experimentation

long_description: PostHog is an open-source product analytics suite built for developers. Feature flags, session recording, heatmaps, and more - all in one platform.
features: Product analytics, Session recording, Feature flags, Heatmaps, A/B testing, Self-hosting
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, can self-host, all-in-one platform, generous free tier CONS: Newer platform, smaller community
use_cases: Product analytics, session replay, feature flags, experimentation, heatmaps

long_description: Hotjar is a behavior analytics and user feedback service that helps you understand how users behave on your website and what they think about it.
features: Heatmaps, Session recordings, Surveys, Feedback widgets, Form analytics, User interviews
pros_cons: PROS: Great visual insights, easy to use, good free tier CONS: Can slow down site, privacy concerns with recordings
use_cases: User behavior analysis, conversion optimization, UX research, feedback collection

long_description: Mailchimp is an all-in-one marketing platform that helps you manage and talk to your clients, customers, and other interested parties.
features: Email campaigns, Marketing automation, Landing pages, Audience segmentation, A/B testing, Reports
pros_cons: PROS: Free tier available, easy to use, many templates CONS: Can get expensive, limited automation on lower tiers
use_cases: Email newsletters, marketing campaigns, automation, audience management

long_description: ConvertKit is the email marketing platform built for creators. Easily create email sequences, tag subscribers, automate your marketing, and more.
features: Email sequences, Landing pages, Forms, Tagging, Automation, Creator network
pros_cons: PROS: Creator-focused, easy automation, good deliverability CONS: Limited design options, can get expensive
use_cases: Newsletter publishing, email courses, product launches, audience building

long_description: HubSpot is a CRM platform with all the software, integrations, and resources you need to connect marketing, sales, content management, and customer service.
features: CRM, Email marketing, Marketing automation, Sales tools, Service Hub, CMS
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive platform, generous free tier, great training CONS: Expensive at scale, can be overwhelming
use_cases: CRM, marketing automation, sales pipeline, email marketing, customer service

long_description: Buffer helps you build an audience organically. We're a values-driven company that provides affordable, intuitive marketing tools for ambitious people and teams.
features: Social scheduling, Analytics, Engagement tools, Landing page, Shop Grid, Team collaboration
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to use, affordable, clean interface, good analytics CONS: Limited features compared to Hootsuite, basic automation
use_cases: Social media scheduling, content planning, social analytics, team collaboration

long_description: Hootsuite is a social media management platform that covers almost every aspect of a social media manager's role.
features: Social scheduling, Monitoring, Analytics, Team workflows, Bulk scheduling, Content curation
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive features, many integrations, team collaboration CONS: Expensive, complex interface, no free tier
use_cases: Social media management, brand monitoring, team collaboration, scheduling

long_description: Zapier is an automation platform that connects your apps and automates workflows. Move info between your web apps automatically, so you can focus on your most important work.
features: Workflow automation, 5000+ app integrations, Multi-step Zaps, Filters, Webhooks, Scheduling
pros_cons: PROS: Huge app ecosystem, easy to use, no coding needed CONS: Can get expensive, task limits, sometimes slow
use_cases: Workflow automation, data syncing, notifications, lead management

long_description: Make is a visual platform that lets you design, build, and automate anything - from tasks and workflows to apps and systems - without coding.
features: Visual automation, 1000+ integrations, Error handling, Webhooks, Scheduling, Advanced logic
pros_cons: PROS: More powerful than Zapier, visual builder, better pricing CONS: Steeper learning curve, smaller community
use_cases: Complex automation, data transformation, API integration, workflow orchestration

long_description: Bubble is a visual programming platform that lets you build web applications without code. Design, develop, and launch production-ready apps.
features: Visual programming, Database, User authentication, Responsive design, API connector, Plugins
pros_cons: PROS: Very powerful, full-stack capabilities, active community CONS: Steep learning curve, performance limitations, vendor lock-in
use_cases: Web apps, SaaS products, marketplaces, internal tools, MVPs

long_description: Retool is the fast way to build internal tools. Drag-and-drop our building blocks and connect them to your databases and APIs to build your own tools.
features: Drag-and-drop builder, Database connectors, API integration, Custom components, Access control, Self-hosting
pros_cons: PROS: Fast development, connects to anything, good for internal tools CONS: Can get expensive, learning curve, design limitations
use_cases: Admin panels, dashboards, CRUD apps, internal tools, database UIs

long_description: Netlify is a platform for web developers that multiplies productivity. Automate deploys, run serverless functions, and collaborate on your sites.
features: Continuous deployment, Serverless functions, Forms, Split testing, Edge handlers, CDN
pros_cons: PROS: Generous free tier, great DX, automatic deployments CONS: Can get expensive with bandwidth, limited on free tier
use_cases: Static sites, JAMstack apps, frontend hosting, serverless functions

long_description: Railway is a deployment platform where you can provision infrastructure, develop with that infrastructure locally, and then deploy to the cloud.
features: One-click deployments, Databases, Environment variables, CLI, Monitoring, Team collaboration
pros_cons: PROS: Simple to use, great for databases, affordable CONS: Limited free tier, smaller ecosystem than AWS
use_cases: Full-stack apps, databases, backend services, microservices

description: Cloud platform for apps and websites
long_description: Render is a unified cloud to build and run all your apps and websites with free SSL, a global CDN, private networks, and auto deploys from Git.
features: Auto-deployments, Static sites, Web services, Databases, Cron jobs, Private networking
pros_cons: PROS: Simple pricing, auto-deployments, free tier for static sites CONS: Can be slow to deploy, limited regions
use_cases: Web apps, static sites, APIs, background workers, databases

long_description: DigitalOcean is a cloud computing platform offering products for developers and businesses to deploy and scale applications.
features: Virtual machines, Managed databases, Kubernetes, Object storage, Load balancers, Monitoring
pros_cons: PROS: Simple pricing, good docs, developer-friendly CONS: Fewer features than AWS, limited global presence
use_cases: Web hosting, databases, Kubernetes, object storage, development environments

long_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services.
features: Compute (EC2), Storage (S3), Databases (RDS), Lambda, CloudFront, 200+ services
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive services, global infrastructure, industry standard CONS: Complex pricing, steep learning curve, can get expensive
use_cases: Any cloud infrastructure need, scalable applications, enterprise systems

long_description: Cloudflare is a global network designed to make everything you connect to the Internet secure, private, fast, and reliable.
features: CDN, DDoS protection, DNS, SSL, Workers, Pages, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: Generous free tier, great performance, security features CONS: Can be complex, occasional issues with bot detection
use_cases: CDN, DDoS protection, DNS management, edge computing, static hosting

long_description: MongoDB is a document database with the scalability and flexibility that you want with the querying and indexing that you need.
features: Document database, Atlas cloud hosting, Flexible schema, Aggregation, Full-text search, Transactions
pros_cons: PROS: Flexible schema, scalable, generous free tier on Atlas CONS: Can be overkill for simple apps, memory intensive
use_cases: Web applications, mobile backends, content management, real-time analytics

long_description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development.
features: ACID compliance, JSON support, Full-text search, Extensions, Advanced data types, Reliability
pros_cons: PROS: Free, robust, feature-rich, excellent documentation CONS: Requires hosting, more complex than NoSQL
use_cases: Web applications, data warehousing, geospatial data, analytics

long_description: PlanetScale is a MySQL-compatible serverless database platform that brings you scale, performance, and reliability - without sacrificing developer experience.
features: Branching, Non-blocking schema changes, Horizontal scaling, Insights, CLI, Serverless
pros_cons: PROS: Great developer experience, branching workflow, generous free tier CONS: MySQL only, some features require paid plans
use_cases: Web applications, SaaS products, scalable databases

description: Google's mobile and web app development platform
long_description: Firebase is Google's mobile platform that helps you quickly develop high-quality apps and grow your business.
features: Realtime database, Authentication, Cloud Firestore, Hosting, Cloud functions, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to get started, realtime capabilities, generous free tier CONS: Vendor lock-in, can get expensive, limited query capabilities
use_cases: Mobile apps, web apps, realtime applications, authentication

long_description: Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker.
features: In-memory storage, Pub/Sub, Caching, Session storage, Real-time analytics, Data structures
pros_cons: PROS: Extremely fast, versatile, simple to use CONS: Data persistence limitations, memory constraints
use_cases: Caching, session storage, real-time analytics, pub/sub, leaderboards

description: Advanced AI assistant for text and analysis
long_description: Claude is an AI assistant created by Anthropic that's helpful, harmless, and honest. It excels at analysis, writing, math, and coding tasks.
features: Text generation, Code assistance, Analysis, Large context window, Vision capabilities, JSON mode
pros_cons: PROS: Strong reasoning, large context, ethical AI, great for analysis CONS: Newer than GPT, smaller ecosystem
use_cases: Content creation, code generation, research, analysis, customer support

long_description: Midjourney is an independent research lab exploring new mediums of thought and expanding the imaginative powers of the human species through AI.
features: AI image generation, Style variations, Upscaling, Fast/Relax modes, Commercial usage, Discord integration
pros_cons: PROS: High-quality images, creative results, active community CONS: Discord-only interface, no free tier, can be slow
use_cases: Marketing visuals, concept art, social media content, product mockups

description: Run machine learning models via API
long_description: Replicate makes it easy to run machine learning models in the cloud. Run open-source models or deploy your own with just a few lines of code.
features: ML model hosting, API access, Open-source models, Custom models, Pay-per-use, Easy deployment
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to use, many models available, fair pricing CONS: Can get expensive with heavy use, cold starts
use_cases: Image generation, image upscaling, text-to-speech, video generation, ML inference

description: Open-source AI model hub and tools
long_description: Hugging Face is the collaboration platform for the machine learning community. Discover, use, and share pre-trained models and datasets.
features: Model hub, Datasets, Transformers library, Inference API, Spaces, AutoTrain
pros_cons: PROS: Huge model library, open-source, active community, free tier CONS: Can be technical, infrastructure required for large models
use_cases: NLP models, computer vision, text generation, model fine-tuning, ML research

long_description: ElevenLabs creates the most realistic, versatile and contextually-aware AI audio. Generate speech in hundreds of new and existing voices.
features: Text-to-speech, Voice cloning, Multiple languages, Voice library, API access, Commercial license
pros_cons: PROS: Very realistic voices, voice cloning, good free tier CONS: Can be expensive, ethical concerns with voice cloning
use_cases: Voiceovers, audiobooks, podcasts, video narration, accessibility

long_description: Next.js is a React framework that gives you building blocks to create web applications. It provides production-ready features like SSR, SSG, routing, and more.
features: Server-side rendering, Static generation, API routes, File-based routing, Image optimization, Built-in CSS
pros_cons: PROS: Great performance, excellent DX, Vercel deployment, active community CONS: Learning curve, opinionated structure
use_cases: Web applications, static sites, e-commerce, dashboards, landing pages

long_description: Vite is a build tool that aims to provide a faster and leaner development experience for modern web projects. It's framework agnostic and lightning fast.
features: Instant server start, Lightning fast HMR, Optimized builds, TypeScript support, Framework agnostic, Plugin ecosystem
pros_cons: PROS: Extremely fast, modern tooling, great DX, framework agnostic CONS: Newer ecosystem, some plugins still catching up
use_cases: React apps, Vue apps, vanilla JS, rapid prototyping, modern web apps

description: Next-generation ORM for Node.js and TypeScript
long_description: Prisma is an open-source ORM that drastically simplifies data modeling, migrations, and data access for SQL databases in Node.js and TypeScript.
features: Type-safe queries, Auto-completion, Database migrations, Multi-database support, Visual database browser, Relations
pros_cons: PROS: Type-safe, great DX, excellent docs, migration system CONS: Learning curve, can be slow with large schemas
use_cases: Database access, API development, backend services, data modeling

long_description: tRPC allows you to easily build & consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation. Move faster by removing the need of a traditional API layer.
features: Type safety, No code generation, Lightweight, React Query integration, WebSocket support, Subscriptions
pros_cons: PROS: Full type safety, no code gen, great DX, lightweight CONS: TypeScript only, requires monorepo for full benefits
use_cases: Full-stack TypeScript apps, internal APIs, real-time applications

long_description: Sentry is an error tracking and performance monitoring platform that helps developers see what actually matters, solve quicker, and learn continuously.
features: Error tracking, Performance monitoring, Release tracking, Source maps, Alerts, Issue triage
pros_cons: PROS: Great error tracking, good free tier, many integrations CONS: Can get expensive, alert fatigue
use_cases: Error tracking, performance monitoring, debugging, release tracking

long_description: LogRocket helps you understand problems affecting your users by combining session replay, performance monitoring, and product analytics.
features: Session replay, Error tracking, Performance monitoring, User analytics, Network logs, Redux/Vuex integration
pros_cons: PROS: Great for debugging, comprehensive insights, session replay CONS: Expensive, can slow down apps, privacy concerns
use_cases: Bug investigation, UX analysis, performance monitoring, customer support

long_description: ESLint is a tool for identifying and reporting on patterns found in ECMAScript/JavaScript code. It helps you write better, more consistent code.
features: Code linting, Configurable rules, Auto-fix, Plugin system, Custom rules, Multiple parser support
pros_cons: PROS: Industry standard, highly configurable, auto-fix, plugin ecosystem CONS: Configuration can be complex, rule conflicts
use_cases: Code quality, JavaScript linting, team code standards, pre-commit hooks

long_description: Prettier is an opinionated code formatter that supports many languages. It removes all original styling and ensures that all outputted code conforms to a consistent style.
features: Code formatting, Multiple languages, Editor integration, Pre-commit hooks, Opinionated defaults, Configurable
pros_cons: PROS: Removes formatting debates, easy to set up, multi-language CONS: Opinionated (can't customize much), occasional odd formatting
use_cases: Code formatting, team consistency, pre-commit hooks, CI/CD

long_description: Jest is a delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity. It works with projects using Babel, TypeScript, Node, React, Angular, Vue and more.
features: Unit testing, Snapshot testing, Code coverage, Mocking, Parallel testing, Watch mode
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to set up, great DX, snapshot testing, good coverage reports CONS: Can be slow, mocking can be confusing
use_cases: Unit testing, integration testing, snapshot testing, TDD

long_description: Cypress is a next generation front end testing tool built for the modern web. It makes setting up, writing, running and debugging tests easy.
features: E2E testing, Time travel debugging, Automatic waiting, Screenshots, Videos, CI integration
pros_cons: PROS: Great DX, visual testing, easy debugging, reliable CONS: Only Chromium-based browsers on free tier, can be slow
use_cases: E2E testing, integration testing, visual testing, CI/CD pipelines

long_description: Playwright enables reliable end-to-end testing for modern web apps. Test across all modern browsers with a single API.
features: Cross-browser testing, Auto-wait, Mobile emulation, Screenshots, Videos, Codegen
pros_cons: PROS: Multi-browser support, fast, modern, great API CONS: Newer than Cypress, smaller community
use_cases: E2E testing, cross-browser testing, mobile testing, visual regression

long_description: Storybook is a frontend workshop for building UI components and pages in isolation. It helps you develop and test components independently from your app.
features: Component isolation, Visual testing, Documentation, Addons, Accessibility testing, Interaction testing
pros_cons: PROS: Great for component development, living documentation, many addons CONS: Setup can be complex, large dependency
use_cases: Component development, design systems, visual testing, documentation

long_description: shadcn/ui is a collection of re-usable components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. Copy and paste into your apps. Not a component library - you own the code.
features: Accessible components, Tailwind CSS, Customizable, TypeScript, Dark mode, CLI
pros_cons: PROS: You own the code, highly customizable, beautiful defaults CONS: Manual updates, not a traditional library
use_cases: React applications, design systems, rapid prototyping, accessible UIs

long_description: Chakra UI is a simple, modular and accessible component library that gives you the building blocks to build React applications.
features: Accessible components, Theming, Dark mode, Responsive styles, Composable, TypeScript
pros_cons: PROS: Great accessibility, easy theming, good docs, TypeScript CONS: Bundle size, less flexibility than headless UI
use_cases: React applications, dashboards, admin panels, rapid prototyping

description: Structured content platform and headless CMS
long_description: Sanity is the unified content platform that powers better digital experiences. Treat content as data and build with modern tools.
features: Structured content, Real-time collaboration, GROQ query language, Customizable studio, APIs, Asset management
pros_cons: PROS: Highly customizable, real-time, great DX, generous free tier CONS: Learning curve, requires React knowledge for customization
use_cases: Content management, headless CMS, e-commerce, documentation, blogs

long_description: Contentful is an API-first content management platform to create, manage and publish content on any digital channel.
features: Headless CMS, Content modeling, APIs, Media management, Localization, Webhooks
pros_cons: PROS: Powerful API, scalable, good free tier, multi-language CONS: Can get expensive, complex for simple use cases
use_cases: Multi-channel content, e-commerce, websites, mobile apps, digital products

long_description: Strapi is the leading open-source headless CMS. It's 100% JavaScript, fully customizable and developer-first.
features: Open source, Content types, RESTful & GraphQL APIs, Media library, Role-based access, Self-hosting
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, self-hostable, customizable, free tier CONS: Requires hosting, setup complexity
use_cases: Content management, APIs, websites, mobile backends, e-commerce

long_description: Cal.com is the open-source Calendly alternative. You are in control of your own data, workflow and appearance.
features: Meeting scheduling, Calendar integrations, Team scheduling, Custom workflows, Webhooks, Self-hosting
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, privacy-focused, customizable, fair pricing CONS: Fewer integrations than Calendly, newer platform
use_cases: Meeting scheduling, client bookings, team scheduling, appointment management

long_description: Calendly is your scheduling automation platform for eliminating the back-and-forth emails for finding the perfect time.
features: Meeting scheduling, Calendar sync, Team pages, Workflows, Integrations, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to use, many integrations, reliable, good free tier CONS: Can get expensive for teams, limited customization
use_cases: Client meetings, sales calls, interviews, team scheduling, consultations

long_description: Typeform makes collecting and sharing information comfortable and conversational. It's a web-based platform you can use to create anything from surveys to apps.
features: Conversational forms, Logic jumps, Integrations, Templates, Analytics, Payments
pros_cons: PROS: Beautiful UX, high completion rates, good templates CONS: Expensive, limited on free tier, slow to build complex forms
use_cases: Surveys, lead generation, quizzes, applications, customer feedback

description: Free form builder, simpler than Typeform
long_description: Tally is the simplest way to create free forms & surveys. Create any type of form in seconds, without knowing how to code, and for free.
features: Unlimited forms, Logic jumps, Calculations, Payment integration, File uploads, Custom domains
pros_cons: PROS: Generous free tier, simple to use, affordable, notion-like editor CONS: Fewer templates than Typeform, smaller ecosystem
use_cases: Forms, surveys, applications, lead capture, event registration

description: Customer data platform and analytics hub
long_description: Segment is a customer data platform (CDP) that helps you collect, clean, and activate your customer data.
features: Data collection, Event tracking, Integrations, Data warehouse, Audience builder, Protocols
pros_cons: PROS: Many integrations, clean data pipeline, good free tier CONS: Can get very expensive, complex setup
use_cases: Analytics integration, customer data, multi-tool tracking, data warehouse

long_description: Umami is a simple, fast, privacy-focused alternative to Google Analytics. It's open source and can be self-hosted.
features: Privacy-focused, Self-hosting, Simple dashboard, Real-time, Event tracking, Multi-site
pros_cons: PROS: Privacy-focused, self-hostable, simple, affordable CONS: Basic features, smaller ecosystem
use_cases: Website analytics, privacy-compliant tracking, simple metrics

long_description: Fathom Analytics is simple, light-weight and privacy-first website analytics. No cookie notices required. GDPR, CCPA and PECR compliant.
features: Privacy-first, No cookies, EU isolation, Uptime monitoring, Email reports, Custom domains
pros_cons: PROS: Privacy-focused, GDPR compliant, simple UI, reliable CONS: Paid only, basic features, limited integrations
use_cases: Website analytics, privacy-compliant tracking, uptime monitoring

long_description: SendGrid is a cloud-based email delivery platform. Send transactional and marketing emails with confidence with the world's largest cloud-based email delivery platform.
features: Email API, SMTP relay, Email templates, Analytics, Marketing campaigns, Deliverability tools
pros_cons: PROS: Reliable delivery, generous free tier, good API CONS: Complex pricing, UI can be confusing
use_cases: Transactional emails, marketing emails, newsletters, automated emails

long_description: Postmark is a fast and reliable transactional email service. Send transactional emails and track them with ease.
features: Transactional email, Templates, Webhooks, Analytics, Deliverability tracking, Dedicated IPs
pros_cons: PROS: Excellent deliverability, fast, great support, clean UI CONS: No free tier, expensive for high volume
use_cases: Transactional emails, password resets, notifications, receipts

long_description: Twilio powers the future of business communications. Enabling phones, VoIP, and messaging to be embedded into web, desktop, and mobile software.
features: SMS, Voice, Video, Email, WhatsApp, Verification, Programmable APIs
pros_cons: PROS: Comprehensive platform, reliable, global coverage, good docs CONS: Can get expensive, complex pricing
use_cases: SMS notifications, phone verification, video calls, messaging apps

long_description: Auth0 is an easy to implement, adaptable authentication and authorization platform. Rapidly integrate authentication and authorization for web, mobile, and legacy applications.
features: User authentication, Social login, Multi-factor auth, Single sign-on, User management, Security
pros_cons: PROS: Easy to implement, comprehensive features, good docs CONS: Can get expensive, complex pricing, vendor lock-in
use_cases: User authentication, social login, SSO, MFA, identity management

long_description: Clerk is a complete suite of embeddable UIs, flexible APIs, and admin dashboards to authenticate and manage your users. Built for React and Next.js.
features: Authentication, User management, Pre-built UI, Social login, MFA, Organizations
pros_cons: PROS: Beautiful UIs, great DX, modern, good free tier CONS: Newer platform, React-focused
use_cases: User authentication, user management, social login, team management

long_description: Algolia is a hosted search engine capable of delivering real-time results from the first keystroke. Built for developers and business teams.
features: Instant search, Typo tolerance, Faceting, Analytics, A/B testing, Recommendations
pros_cons: PROS: Blazing fast, relevant results, good DX, generous free tier CONS: Can get expensive, vendor lock-in
use_cases: Site search, app search, e-commerce search, autocomplete, recommendations

long_description: Meilisearch is a powerful, fast, open-source search engine that is easy to use and deploy. An alternative to Algolia that you can self-host.
features: Full-text search, Typo tolerance, Filtering, Faceting, Instant search, Multi-language
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, fast, easy to use, self-hostable CONS: Requires hosting, fewer features than Algolia
use_cases: Site search, app search, documentation search, e-commerce

long_description: Upstash is a serverless data platform with Redis and Kafka. Pay-per-request pricing with per-request Redis and durable Kafka.
features: Serverless Redis, Kafka, Rate limiting, Workflow, Vector database, Global replication
pros_cons: PROS: Serverless pricing, generous free tier, fast, global CONS: Limited compared to self-hosted Redis
use_cases: Caching, session storage, rate limiting, queues, real-time apps

long_description: Neon is a fully managed serverless Postgres with a generous free tier. We separated storage and compute to offer autoscaling, branching, and bottomless storage.
features: Serverless Postgres, Branching, Autoscaling, Point-in-time restore, Connection pooling, Bottomless storage
pros_cons: PROS: True serverless, branching workflow, generous free tier, fast CONS: Newer platform, some Postgres features limited
use_cases: Web applications, serverless apps, preview environments, development databases

description: Serverless database with search and analytics
long_description: Xata is a serverless database built on PostgreSQL. It combines relational database, search, and analytics in a single platform.
features: Serverless Postgres, Full-text search, File attachments, Branching, TypeScript SDK, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: All-in-one platform, generous free tier, great DX, search built-in CONS: Newer platform, smaller community
use_cases: Web applications, search-heavy apps, content platforms, analytics

long_description: Cursor is the AI-first code editor. Built to make you extraordinarily productive, it's designed from the ground up for pair-programming with AI.
features: AI code completion, Chat with your code, Cmd+K to edit, Codebase understanding, Multi-file editing, VS Code compatible
pros_cons: PROS: Powerful AI features, VS Code fork, great for productivity CONS: Subscription required for best features, can be expensive
use_cases: Code generation, code refactoring, learning new codebases, rapid development

description: AI pair programmer from GitHub and OpenAI
long_description: GitHub Copilot is an AI pair programmer that helps you write code faster and with less work. It draws context from your code to suggest whole lines or entire functions.
features: Code completion, Multi-language support, IDE integration, Chat, Code explanation, Test generation
pros_cons: PROS: Great suggestions, many languages, IDE integration, constantly improving CONS: Subscription required, occasional irrelevant suggestions
use_cases: Code completion, boilerplate generation, learning syntax, rapid prototyping

long_description: v0 is a generative user interface system by Vercel powered by AI. It generates copy-and-paste friendly React code based on shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS.
features: UI generation, React code, shadcn/ui, Tailwind CSS, Iterations, Export code
pros_cons: PROS: Quick UI generation, modern code output, iterative refinement CONS: Limited to specific stack, credit system
use_cases: Rapid prototyping, UI components, landing pages, dashboard layouts

long_description: Supabase Vector (pgvector) is an open-source vector database. Store and query vector embeddings from your Postgres database.
features: Vector storage, Similarity search, Postgres extension, Hybrid search, Embeddings, OpenAI integration
pros_cons: PROS: Built into Postgres, open source, easy to use, generous free tier CONS: Performance limits compared to dedicated vector DBs
use_cases: AI applications, semantic search, RAG systems, recommendations, chatbots

long_description: Pinecone is a vector database that makes it easy to build high-performance vector search applications. Purpose-built for working with vector embeddings.
features: Vector search, Hybrid search, Metadata filtering, Namespaces, Real-time updates, Serverless
pros_cons: PROS: Purpose-built for vectors, fast, scalable, good free tier CONS: Vendor lock-in, can get expensive
use_cases: Semantic search, recommendations, RAG, anomaly detection, similarity search

long_description: LangChain is a framework for developing applications powered by language models. It provides composable tools and integrations for building with LLMs.
features: LLM chains, Agents, Memory, Retrieval, Tools, Monitoring
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, comprehensive, active community, many integrations CONS: Abstraction overhead, fast-moving API changes
use_cases: Chatbots, RAG systems, agents, document Q&A, data analysis
